page.title: 07AMENITIES IN CHAPEL-FRITH
page.content: Shops in Chapel have decreased and estate agents opened.People are more mobile in their shopping,travelling into neighbouring towns.Market Day is Thursday. Older trades still existing are a mobile blacksmith & two bakers. The cinema closed & was demolished.The magistrate's court has been trans- ferred to Buxton.New amenities include a youth club,Over 60's club and new warden-controlled houses for the elderly at Eccles Fold replacing The Elms which was originally a workhouse. Leisure facilities include tennis & bowls in the Memorial Park,golf,judo, cricket,football,badminton.The Memor- ial Club provides discos & groups, there is a local amateur dramatic society.The few remaining customs are the bell-ringers & the annual carnival.
